content.question: ​The function <math alttext="Q"><mi>Q</mi></math> is a polynomial of degree <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>. If <math alttext="Q open parentheses 5 close parentheses equals 0"><mi>Q</mi><mfenced><mn>5</mn></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, which of the following must be true?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="Q open parentheses negative 5 close parentheses equals 0"><mi>Q</mi><mfenced><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

​<math alttext="Q open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>Q</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> can be expressed as <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 5 close parentheses times P open parentheses x close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>·</mo><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="P open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is a polynomial of degree <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>.

​<math alttext="Q open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>Q</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> can be expressed as <math alttext="fraction numerator P open parentheses x close parentheses over denominator x minus 5 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>, where <math alttext="P open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is a polynomial of degree <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math>.

content.answer: ​<math alttext="Q open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>Q</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> can be expressed as <math alttext="open parentheses x minus 5 close parentheses times P open parentheses x close parentheses"><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>·</mo><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="P open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is a polynomial of degree <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
